definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: But I tell you that anyone who is angry with his brother [2] will be subject to judgment.
sentences.chinese: 只是我告訴你們，凡向弟兄動怒的，難免受審判。

sentences.english: Very easily offended, you do not want to insult a hippogriff .
sentences.chinese: 很容易動怒，因此你們不要想侮辱一隻鷹馬。

sentences.english: Then he said, "May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak."
sentences.chinese: 亞伯拉罕說，求主不要動怒，容我說。

sentences.english: When it is called for, give us the kind of anger that builds up and does not tear down.
sentences.chinese: 在有需要動怒時，賜我們那建立而非拆毀的怒氣。

sentences.english: Three younger sister four younger sister saw his mother angry, imagine usual pass the buck to each other.
sentences.chinese: 三妹四妹見母親動怒，想像往常一樣把責任推給對方。

sentences.english: The bellows puffed on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 風箱能扇火，言語可動怒。

sentences.english: You need not flare up merely because I mentioned your work.
sentences.chinese: 你大可不必因爲我提到你的工作就動怒。

definition: not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to lose one's cool/to get impatient/unable to remain calm
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
to use violence (against sb)/to strong-arm sb/to manhandle
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
to whisper to one another's ear
